The US has a good number of spooky units, and most folks barely know they exist. The ISA (The Activity) is JSOC’s covert brain and muscle, running live HUMINT, SIGINT, and targeting for the shooters. INSCOM runs field signals and human intel, often buried deep with JSOC teams. DIA’s Defense Clandestine Service is the Pentagon’s own network of spies working long-term sources in denied zones. ONI’s deep ops teams handle undersea and maritime reconnaissance that never makes the news. The Air Force’s 24th SOW and 17th STS tie ISR and precision targeting directly into special ops. MARSOC’s tech teams manage digital recon and exploitation for Raider missions. Cyber Command and NSA’s hunt teams do the dirty work in the digital battlespace, finding, breaking, and weaponizing access. Together they form the quiet layer between SOF and the three-letter agencies, the ones who see everything before the lights go out. I’ve seen a number of these guys in action and it’s something else entirely. Pure competence of the highest order. The ISA is in its own class. Every major nation has its own “shadow service” for technical reconnaissance and covert HUMINT, but the Activity sits in a category that most allies don’t even attempt to replicate. Basically we have eyes, ears, and then some all over the globe at all times. permalink parent award report block reply BreakingCNN 2 points 19 hours ago Well that explains the WMDs in Iraq.

INSCOM runs field signals and human intel, often buried deep with JSOC teams. DIA’s Defense Clandestine Service is the Pentagon’s own network of spies working long-term sources in denied zones. ONI’s deep ops teams handle undersea and maritime reconnaissance that never makes the news. The Air Force’s 24th SOW and 17th STS tie ISR and precision targeting directly into special ops. MARSOC’s tech teams manage digital recon and exploitation for Raider missions. Cyber Command and NSA’s hunt teams do the dirty work in the digital battlespace, finding, breaking, and weaponizing access. Together they form the quiet layer between SOF and the three-letter agencies, the ones who see everything before the lights go out. I’ve seen a number of these guys in action and it’s something else entirely. Pure competence of the highest order. The ISA is in its own class. ONI’s deep ops teams handle undersea and maritime reconnaissance that never makes the news. The Air Force’s 24th SOW and 17th STS tie ISR and precision targeting directly into special ops. MARSOC’s tech teams manage digital recon and exploitation for Raider missions. Cyber Command and NSA’s hunt teams do the dirty work in the digital battlespace, finding, breaking, and weaponizing access. Together they form the quiet layer between SOF and the three-letter agencies, the ones who see everything before the lights go out. I’ve seen a number of these guys in action and it’s something else entirely. Pure competence of the highest order. The ISA is in its own class. Every major nation has its own “shadow service” for technical reconnaissance and covert HUMINT, but the Activity sits in a category that most allies don’t even attempt to replicate. Basically we have eyes, ears, and then some all over the globe at all times. permalink parent award report block reply
